WRITING.TEXT: If you really want to blow your mind, replace the worn old capacitors, it'll bring everything back into spec. Even just doing the main psu caps makes a good difference

It's just an interesting concept for me because I've never lived somewhere long term where my water wasn't as private as it got, ie: it came out of the ground the house was built on. And to make it better, no power = no water.
But I wouldn't trade it for anything. Our water growing up was better than anything that comes out of a bottle, perfect ph, naturally limestone filtered, nice and crisp. Our relatives used to bring 5gal jugs to fill when they visited us.
Septic tanks on the other hand fucking suck

I mean, I meant that my blender turning into a frag grenade scared the shit out of me...
I whisk my poop shakes like a man.
To be fair it is lot more reliable than using a binned DC motor and some rectifier diodes
I can't help but laugh when my coworkers tell stories like this from China (where several of them are from). We came to the conclusion that China is more American than America
